name: Ben McClelland
body:
[LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/mcclellandben](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mcclellandben)  
[GitHub - https://github.com/benmcclelland](https://github.com/benmcclelland)

I currently work at [Versity](http://www.versity.com/), which delivers a software only enterprise archiving filesystem.
I used to work at [Los Alamos National Laboratory](http://www.lanl.gov/) in the [High Performance Computing](http://www.lanl.gov/org/padste/adtsc/hpc/index.php) group where I did support, planning, and integration for some of the country's largest clusters and storage systems.
![ben](http://benmcclelland.github.io/ben.jpg)

For a short while I also worked at [Intel](http://www.intel.com/) where I was developing software for the distributed runtime systems for future HPC procurements.

Most of the projects I worked on at LANL (some can be found [here](https://github.com/hpc)), Intel (resource manager can be found [here](https://github.com/open-mpi/orcm) and is part of the larger [Open MPI](https://github.com/open-mpi) project), and Versity are written in C.  
I have experience with distrbiuted systems communicating using [MPI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Message_Passing_Interface), sockets, and [ZeroMQ](http://zeromq.org/).  
I have recently been exploring Go by writing a small distributed work queue that can run simple parallel workloads across several hosts. I am really enjoying working in [Go](https://golang.org/), and hope to use it more in the future.

### Interests:

* Linux Storage Systems
* High Performance Computing
* Hiking
* Going off road in the Jeep!

### About me:

I live in beautiful [Portland, OR](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portland%2C_Oregon)  
I like to hike in the [Forest Park](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forest_Park_(Portland,_Oregon)) area with the family  
And visit the [Oregon Coast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oregon_Coast) for a short family weekend getaway
